meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a forceful blow.
meanings.sent1: He was smiting the nail with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The warrior was smiting the enemy with his sword.
meanings.sent3: The chef was smiting the dough to make it flat.
meanings.sent4: The storm was smiting the trees with fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith was smiting the metal to shape it into a sword.

meanings.definition: To afflict or attack with a powerful force or emotion.
meanings.sent1: Guilt was smiting his conscience after the mistake.
meanings.sent2: The illness was smiting the village, spreading quickly.
meanings.sent3: Laughter was smiting the room as the comedian told jokes.
meanings.sent4: Fear was smiting her heart as she walked through the dark alley.
meanings.sent5: Love was smiting his soul, making him feel alive and happy.
